dev.control

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.control.FileManager

  • public final class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    FileManager Description: Manages file operations, keeps paths required to route any picture and sound related operations. Maintains a highscore table that has size 10, updates accordingly.
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    A. Burak Sahin, Melis Kizildemir

      • setScorer

        public void setScorer(java.lang.String name,
                      int score)
        Sets the specified scorer in its appropriate position in the highscores table.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the scorer.
        score - is the score he/she made.

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile()
        scorers = |__0__|__1__|__2__|__3__|__4__|__5__|..

        As shown above, since the string array will be of even size, and since we know that each entry contains a pair of name and score so we can safely assume that at each of 0, 2, 4... indicies there will be a string which is the name of the scorer and at each of 1, 3, 5... indicies there will be a number which is the score made by the user.

        That will be the basis of operations througout.

      • readFile

        public java.lang.String[] readFile()
        This function reads the file HIGHSCORERS_FILE and tokenizes it
        Returns:
